meanings.definition: A section of a publication that can be easily removed.
meanings.sent1: In the magazine, there is a pullout with fun puzzles.
meanings.sent2: I always enjoy reading the recipes in the cooking pullout of the newspaper.
meanings.sent3: The pullout with the comic strips made me laugh out loud.
meanings.sent4: The pullout about travel destinations was like a window to the world.
meanings.sent5: The pullout on gardening was so colorful and informative.

meanings.definition: The act of withdrawing or removing something.
meanings.sent1: The soldier's quick pullout saved him from danger.
meanings.sent2: The pullout of the troops was a strategic decision by the general.
meanings.sent3: The sudden pullout of the cake from the oven surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her pullout of the weeds in the garden was like a swift cleanup.
meanings.sent5: The pullout of the old furniture made the room feel more spacious.

meanings.definition: A piece of furniture that can be converted into a bed.
meanings.sent1: The sofa in the living room has a pullout for guests to sleep on.
meanings.sent2: I prefer a pullout for guests rather than a separate bed.
meanings.sent3: The pullout in the couch was a comfortable spot for napping.
meanings.sent4: The pullout bed in the camper was like a hidden surprise.
meanings.sent5: The pullout in the sofa made movie nights extra cozy.
